growth.showLifetime: Show growth to age 65 (after IRA conversion at 18)
growth.contributionPlanDesc: Set how much you'll contribute during different periods. Max $5,000/year ($417/mo) from all sources.
growth.depositOnlyDesc: No family contributions — just the $1,000 pilot deposit
growth.pilotGrows: $1,000 pilot deposit grows on its own
growth.olderChildWarning: A child born in {birthYear} would be {startAge} when contributions begin in 2025. They have {yearsOfGrowth} years of tax-deferred growth before the account converts to a traditional IRA at age 18 ({endYear}).
eligibility.needThis: We need this to check age eligibility and pilot deposit qualification.
eligibility.isCitizen: Is your child a U.S. citizen?
eligibility.citizenOnly: Trump Accounts are available only to U.S. citizens.
eligibility.hasSSN: Does your child have a valid SSN?
eligibility.ssnRequired: A valid Social Security Number is required to open a Trump Account.
eligibility.eligibleWithPilot: Great news! Your child qualifies for a Trump Account AND the $1,000 federal pilot deposit.
eligibility.eligibleNoPilot: Your child qualifies for a Trump Account, but not the $1,000 pilot deposit.
eligibility.partialMsg: Your child can open a Trump Account, but is not eligible for the $1,000 pilot deposit.
eligibility.ineligibleMsg: Unfortunately, your child does not currently qualify for a Trump Account.
eligibility.citizenRequired: The child must be a U.S. citizen to qualify for a Trump Account.
eligibility.ssnRequiredDetail: A valid Social Security Number (SSN) is required.
eligibility.pilotDepositDetail: Your child qualifies for the one-time $1,000 federal deposit for children born 2025–2028.
eligibility.fileForm: File IRS Form 4547 with your 2025 tax return (due April 15, 2026) or through the trumpaccounts.gov portal (available mid-2026).
employer.employerContribHelp: Employers can contribute up to $2,500/year per employee (tax-free under IRC §128)
employer.chartTitle: Growth: With vs Without Employer Contribution
employer.bullet1: Employers can contribute up to $2,500/year per employee (not per child)
employer.bullet2: Employer contributions are tax-free under IRC §128
employer.bullet3: Employer + personal contributions combined cannot exceed $5,000/year
employer.bullet4: This is a new employee benefit — ask your HR department about it
mini.growth.title: Millionaire Baby Calculator
mini.eligibility.title: Eligibility Checker
mini.employer.title: Employer Match Tool
countdown.babiesMsg: Babies born before Dec 31, 2028 get a free $1,000 federal deposit
countdown.expired: The $1,000 pilot deposit window has closed.
countdown.expiredDetail: Children born after 2028 can still open Trump Accounts — they just won't receive the federal deposit.
countdown.shareText: Did you know? Babies born before Dec 31, 2028 get a FREE $1,000 federal investment deposit via Trump Accounts (IRC §530A). Check eligibility: https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/eligibility-checker
